NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Movies and Attendance or the cell corresponding to Football and Ticket Sales?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Football} and {Ticket Sales} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Football and Attendance or the cell corresponding to Publishing and Royalties?

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Media Rights and Ticket Sales or the cell corresponding to Publishing and Viewership?

NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Gaming} and {Viewership} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.20 to 0.41?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Movies, Attendance), (Tennis, Attendance), (Movies, Fan Engagement), (Publishing, Fan Engagement), (Tennis, Fan Engagement), (Movies, Royalties), (Publishing, Royalties), (Movies, Social Media), (Publishing, Social Media), (Movies, Sponsorship), (Publishing, Sponsorship), (Movies, Ticket Sales), (Publishing, Ticket Sales), (Movies, Viewership), (Publishing, Viewership), (Tennis, Viewership)}.
